titlestmt.titleproper: Institute of International Education records, Publications, Microforms, RG 3, Series 2
A Guide to the Institute of International Education records, Publications, Microforms, RG 3, Series 2 FA1315

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-12-04 00:07:29 -0500.

did.unittitle: Institute of International Education records, Publications, Microforms, RG 3, Series 2

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Institute of International Education (New York, N.Y.)

did.physdesc: 106 16mm reels of microfilm including 38 reels of unique content and duplicate reels.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Institute of International Education (IIE) was established in 1919 by Nobel Prize winners Nicholas Murray Butler, Elihu Root and Stephen Duggan, Sr. The founders sought greater understanding among nations, primarily through the establishment of international educational exchange between United States institutes of higher education and foreign actors interested in formulating and developing active and ongoing educational understanding. As the Institute grew, developed and matured, it has continued to focus in the area of scholars exchange, as well as education services, international development and leadership training.

IIE initially focused on facilitating student, faculty, and teacher exchanges with European countries. In the 1930s their scope expanded beyond Europe to include exchanges between the Soviet Union and Latin America. During this period the Institute also established the Emergency Committee to Aid Displaced German Scholars which later expanded to include scholars fleeing facist Spain and Italy as well. In the 1950s this program was utilized to support Hungarian refugees. In the early 2000s IIE Trustees together with other donors endowed the Scholar Rescue Fund (SRF).

Following WWII, the Institute helped establish the Association of International Educators (NAFSA) and the Council on International Education Exchange (CIEE) for which they serve to administer the CIEE faculty component and the graduate student component of the Fullbright program, which continues to today as the Institute's largest program.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Records were transferred to RAC by the Institute of International Education through several accessions in 2017.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Council for International Exchange of Scholars (CIES) collection is available at the University of Arkansas.
The Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars records are available at the New York Public Library.
The International Fellowship Fund (IFF) Archives are available at Columbia University.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Institute of International Education records are available in the following other finding aids:
Institute of International Education records, Alumni and Historical Files, RG 1 (FA1289)
Institute of International Education records, Fellowship Cards (Grantee Locator Cards), RG 2 (FA1290)
Institute of International Education records, Publications, Paper records, RG 3, Series 1 (FA1291)
Institute of International Education records, Photographic Files, RG 4 (FA1288)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Institute of International Education archives were deposited at the RAC by IIE in June 2016. The Institute of International Education retains all rights, including but not limited to legal title, copyright, and intellectual property rights, in so far as it holds them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains publications produced by the Institute of International Education (IIE), publications produced by IIE in partnership with others, as well as publications collected by IIE that were produced by other foundations, institutions and government agencies. Contents include: reports, pamphlets, surveys, conference proceedings, policy papers, a selection of IIE Annual Reports and Bulletins. Much of the material is guides for foreign students studying in the United States, U.S. students studying abroad as well as guides for foreign students returning home following the completion of their residencies in the United States. Records may or may not duplicate those found in "Publications, Paper records, RG 3, Series 1" (FA1291).
